review: Well, Armaan Kohli is love. I loved his acting and why this movie didn't win an oscar is still a mystery. The best ensemble cast in the history of cinema. I am eagerly waiting for the sequel. I will show this movie to my kids, so that they learn to appreciate quality films at a young age. But then again,it has some objectionable love scenes which I would not want my kids to see at a very young age. So, I will wait till they're 15 and then we watch movie and have the TALK!

Wow! every 90s kid knows JAANI DUSHMAN....it truly has a ANOKHI kahani. Its a legendary movie, an epic. This is one movie that has the 3 most important ingredients to make a hit movie, 
1.Entertainment 2. Entertainment 3.Entertainment.
 The genre of this movie, hmmm...it would be tough to categorize under 1 category  as once it released I am sure it turned out to be a HORROR movie for its producers, unintended COMIC movie for its audiences and truly an ACTION movie for the director as I am sure the producers must have wanted to kill him for this disaster and finally a MYSTERY movie as it always raises this question that what made all these actors sign this movie !!!
 
special applaud to the guy who did the special effects ....master piece man !

This is the best movie to ever grace humankind. 
The special effects rival Avengers: Endgame (for it's time). 
The plot is like a crossover between Baahubali and Inception, incorporating both ancient and modern, scientific and supernatural plot elements.
It's a star-studded cast, as evident by its poster, and so the acting is incredible, especially, surprisingly, by Sonu Nigam. Who even know he could act as well as he could sing?

It's a cult classic movie, this movie is so bad that's it's really good,

Sonu nigam is the god of acting , Raj babbar, s multi religious locket  is love. 
Aaja aaja is the best is song in the history of Bollywood

i really loved this movie then n even now. i will defend it till my death. all d actors performed really well. the action was brilliant. d only thing i did nt like was aditya pancholi playing a college student, then why left raj babbar.

Me and my brother watched this on repeat for 14 times when it released on digital print. Why this movie never graced oscars is an indication of how rigged the awards are. Its 2019 and I can still watch this movie every weekend.
